reviews.text: I'm thrilled to share my experience with the THERMOS FUNTAINER 16 Ounce Stainless Steel Vacuum Insulated Bottle, which has become my go-to bottle for hot and cold drinks. As someone who's always on the go, I need a bottle that can keep up with my active lifestyle, and this one delivers. The FUNTAINER bottle is made of high-quality stainless steel that's durable and resistant to rust. The vacuum insulation is top-notch, keeping drinks hot for hours or cold for even longer. I've tested it with both hot coffee and cold water, and it's performed flawlessly. What I love most about this bottle is its versatility. The 16-ounce size is perfect for a morning coffee or a post-workout water, and the leak-proof lid makes it easy to take on the go. The bottle is also easy to clean and maintain, with a wide mouth that makes it simple to add ice or clean the interior. I've been impressed by the quality of this product, and I can tell it will last for years to come. The FUNTAINER bottle is a great value for the price, and I'm so glad I invested in it. **Pros:** * High-quality stainless-steel construction that's durable and resistant to rust * Top-notch vacuum insulation keeps drinks hot or cold for hours * Leak-proof lid makes it easy to take on the go * Easy to clean and maintain with a wide mouth * Great value for the price **Cons:** None! I hope this review helps others discover the benefits of this amazing, insulated bottle!

reviews.text: We have at least a dozen water bottles and this is probably my favorite to use for my kiddo and is the one we bring to school. It has all the features I was looking for: 1) Perfect size for a toddler to early grade school aged child, and fits small hands; 2) Made of stainless steel, sturdy yet not heavy for a toddler to carry; 3) Drinking spout is made of silicone, not plastic; 4) The best feature is that the lid closes over the spout and pops open with the touch of a button, ensuring that the mouthpiece keeps clean and covered when not in use, and your hand doesn‚Äôt have to touch it either. For hygiene reasons the lid was a really important design feature to us and was something I specifically looked for in a kids water bottle: that the mouthpiece is not exposed, the lid can be opened by a young child without effort and is attached to the bottle so won‚Äôt get lost; 5) Easy to clean and the silicone part pops off and on easily. The seal works well and the bottle has not leaked so far; 6) Keeps beverages cool or hot/warm for a good while. I haven‚Äôt tested how long, but for our purposes it‚Äôs fine for getting through a school day (not looking for rugged outback multi-day peak performance functionality here); 6) Also nice that they come in many colors and designs! It was surprisingly uncommon to find a water bottle that fit all these criteria, so I was really happy to come across this Thermos bottle that fit the bill! We‚Äôve had ours for almost a year now and bring it to school daily, and it‚Äôs still working perfectly.

reviews.text: The YETI Rambler Jr. 12 oz Kids Bottle with the straw cap is definitely an investment, but it's one we‚Äôre so glad we made! While it‚Äôs on the pricier side, its durability and design have proven to be totally worth it. Our toddler is quite the little adventurer, and this bottle has survived countless tosses, drops, and spills without showing signs of damage. Unlike other kids' bottles that break or crack after just a few rough uses, this one stands up to the test. The straw cap is an excellent feature for young kids, making it easy for our toddler to drink from without making a mess. Plus, it‚Äôs spill-proof, which is a huge bonus when you‚Äôve got a busy, active child. The bottle is also easy to clean, which is essential for us. We've thrown it in the dishwasher multiple times, and it‚Äôs still in great condition. We really appreciate the high-quality build of this bottle. The double-wall vacuum insulation keeps drinks cold for hours, which is perfect for both outdoor play and car trips. Whether it‚Äôs a hot summer day or a chilly winter outing, the YETI bottle keeps liquids at the right temperature, making it more convenient and enjoyable for our toddler to stay hydrated. The size is also ideal for little hands. It fits perfectly in our child‚Äôs grip, and the compact design makes it easy to throw into a diaper bag or backpack without taking up too much space. I‚Äôll admit, it‚Äôs a bit on the expensive side compared to other bottles, but given how tough and well-made it is, I would recommend it to any parent with an active child. The quality and longevity of this product make it a wise investment, and I expect it to last us through many more years of use. If you're looking for a bottle that can withstand the wear and tear of toddler life and still look great, the YETI Rambler Jr. is a fantastic choice! Definitely worth the price for the peace of mind and the reliable performance.

reviews.text: We‚Äôve gone through a lot of kids‚Äô water bottles over the years, and the YETI Rambler Jr. is hands-down the toughest one we‚Äôve owned. My kid has dropped it on pavement, tossed it in the car, and left it rolling around in a backpack, and it still looks and works like new. The insulation is top-tier: it keeps water ice-cold for hours, even on hot days at the park. The straw lid is genuinely leak-resistant when closed, which gives me peace of mind. (It‚Äôll dribble a bit if left open and tipped, but that‚Äôs expected.) I also appreciate that it‚Äôs super easy to clean, dishwasher safe, and the straw disassembles without much fuss. The colors are vibrant and kid-friendly, and the handle makes it easy for little hands to carry. A couple of things to note: -> It‚Äôs heavier than a typical plastic bottle‚Äîsomething to consider if your kiddo prefers super lightweight gear. -> The straw has popped out a couple of times when refilling, but it‚Äôs easy to snap back in. Overall, it‚Äôs a great choice if you want a bottle that can survive serious kid use and still keep drinks cold all day. Worth the price for the quality and durability. Still need to keep an eye on the nooks and crannies for mild accumulation so I‚Äôd wash it every few days, maybe more in the summer. Easy enough to disassemble and clean though Would definitely buy again (and probably will once my younger one is old enough for one too). Update: make sure to check the interior of the cap unit for mold accumulation. Definitely think this should be washed multiple times per week.

reviews.text: We love these water bottles. Best product out there. We have a cabinet full of them and they go to school every day with a 5 year old and a 3 year old. They're dependable, they don't leak, they are designed and built really well, incredibly easy to clean and they last a really long time. 9.8 out of 10. MY ONLY COMPLAINT IS THE PACKAGING! If the person at this company that is in charge of packaging reads these reviews PLEASE STOP USING THE GLUE ADHESIVE ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE BOTTLE!!! The water bottles arrive with minimal packaging, just a little double sided cardboard flap with product information on it. The issue is that the flaps are stuck to the side of the bottle with like NASA grade adhesive THAT DOES NOT COME OFF!!! You spend 10 minutes trying peel it off, trying to roll it off with the side of your thumb, I've tried dish soap and warm water solution, I've tried baby oil solution, I tried a plastic blade made for scraping dried residue off the inside of my grill, and yet, an adhesive smudge remains. These beautiful bottles forever marred with the residue of 1000% unnecessary adhesive. The company could actually save money if they stopped buying adhesive and it would make their product better. There is no reason that cardboard flap needs to be stuck down to the side of the bottle. I just bought a 2 pack of water bottles, each bottle has 2 globs of adhesive on EACH side. That's 8 globs of adhesive I now have to spend at least 15-20 minutes trying to remove as much as I can already knowing I'm going to fail. That's outrageous. I should have to spend ZERO minutes fighting with the packaging of a product.

reviews.text: When my daughter started preschool at 18 months, she joined the pre-toddlers class, which required her to have her own water bottle! I wanted one that would last her into elementary school but that was easy for her to use now, so we got this one. It's lovely, insulated, holds a reasonable amount of water, and easy for her to open and close. I love the little details like the pullable tab in the silicone gasket of the lid so that we can pull it out for washing and clear it of any smells without having to struggle to get between the silicone and the plastic to pull it out. It is well-made. She has dropped it dozens of times (often dozens of times per day!) at school, home, and at the playground, and the colours are still vibrant, without any dings or scratches. My only gripe is that the little silicone bumper at the bottom to allow it to be put down softly just never stays on. It fell off so often that we almost lost it, so we just never use it anymore.

reviews.text: My kids are notorious for losing or destroying water bottles. Seriously, it's a constant battle. But this CamelBak eddy+ Kids Water Bottle has been a game-changer! It's tough, leak-proof (a HUGE plus!), and my kids actually like using it. First off, the Tritan Renew material seems really durable. It's survived multiple drops, being thrown around in backpacks, and even a few accidental trips through the dishwasher (top rack, of course!). No cracks or leaks so far, which is a miracle in my house. The bite valve is easy for my kids to use, and it really does prevent leaks. I'm so tired of finding soggy backpacks and lunch bags! They can toss this bottle in their bag without me having to worry about spills. The flow is also just right ‚Äì not too fast, not too slow. I also appreciate that it's easy to clean. The wide mouth makes it easy to get a sponge in there, and the bite valve comes apart for thorough cleaning. Hygiene is important, especially with kids, so this is a big plus. And let's not forget the fun designs! My kids were actually excited to pick out their own bottles, and they love the bright colors and patterns. It makes drinking water a little more fun for them, which is always a win. Honestly, this CamelBak eddy+ Kids Water Bottle is worth the investment. It's durable, leak-proof, easy to clean, and my kids love it. If you're looking for a water bottle that can withstand the rigors of childhood, I highly recommend this one. It's been a lifesaver in our house!

reviews.text: This line of stainless steel bottles has multiple sizes but they're constructed the same. This line is quality products. I have this one and two of the 12 oz bottles. They are constructed of stainless steel and they are coated in some sort of thermal coating that feels kind of like a high impact material. The coating has a texture to it, enough to make it easy to hold. The cap fits on very well. It tightens down securely and uses gasket for a firm seal, it doesn't allow any leaks and of course helps the bottle be thermal. The bottles have a nice look and feel and haven't shown any wear yet. reviews.text: After seeing all the reviews about mold on EVERY brand of kid's water bottle, I just had to come review this so I could say my piece. First, we had children's CamelBak bottles for 3 years now and they are great water bottles. For an inexpensive price I bought a package of replacement bite valves because my kids will chew on the valves and eventually they leak. This is normal wear and tear people. Second, any object that is subjected to bacteria is going to eventually grow something. It's not poison people. Just clean the darn thing. Get one of those little bottle brushes and really examine the bottle parts and make sure it's clean. If need be, dunk it briefly in a mixture of water and bleach and let it air dry. CamelBaks are great bc they really don't have a ton of parts so if you are of moderate intelligence you should be able to clean it. I know the big thing is to be scared of BLACK MOLD but it's often just the color of stuff growing.. You will find this happens on bath toys, those bulb nose snot suckers and anything that doesn't dry off between use. My experience with this water bottle is: It's durable! Kids fling it, drop it, drag it everywhere, chew on it, what have you and they don't break. It holds a nice amount of liquid. It's a great size at 4l (someone wrote that that is 14 oz). Many cups for kids are 10oz and that's just too small. It's cute and there are many designs to choose from. It's pretty leak proof. Sometimes through wear and tear on the bite valve or user error putting it back together, it has leaked a bit. But overall this thing is very leakproof.

reviews.text: My daughter is 3 she loves the designs of the cup. My son is 1 1/2 he is super picky when it comes to cups and this is the only cup he likes to drink from. We have about 6 of these cups and used most of them for over a year and some for almost 2. They are not leak proof. My son pushes the bite valve in to spill water out and my daughter loves super ice water (maraca water as we call it) but the pressure from cold to hot makes it leak. We only use for water because we would rather have water leak then anything else and our kids love water so it doesn't bug them. The bite valves will get bitten but I have replacements ready. My son bites hard on the cups and my daughter did at his age too. So I recommend buying replacement valves (they have kits with valves of all colors and some kits with extra straws) when getting the cups. The best thing about these cups is that they are so easy to clean. With and without dishwasher, we've done both. I never worried about them not being clean and with replacement pieces for almost everything (bite valve, straws, and caps) it is easier than other cups. Overall, we have used some of these cups for almost 2 years and bought more over time. They are the number one cups for our children and I dont see that changing anytime soon. They do have flaws but all things do just be prepared with extra bite valves and straws.

But we trust it not to leak enough to leave it in bed with him at night and when he is running around the house, get to have him carry it since its tough and leak proof.. and unlike some baby things, the straw/lid/mouthpiece/cup all come apart for easily to clean in the dishwasher

reviews.text: We love this water bottle! We bought one a while back for my 18 month old and it was great to carry around in the diaper bag. It was very easy for him to learn how to drink from it. Now he has a little brother (10 months old now) and he kept stealing it, so now we bought this one for boy #2. He learned how to drink from it very quickly and it's super easy for him, and not to heavy for him to hold when it's full of water. It's also pretty sturdy, my son throws it off the high chair quite often, and it usually is fine. Just as long as it doesn't happen to land straight on the mouthpiece on the floor, because that pushes the mouthpiece into the bottle, making an opening, and then there's tons of water on the floor. :) 4 Stars because sometimes it does leak. I think part of it might be a water pressure issue, putting cold water in it when it's really warm in the house or outside makes it leak more. But for the ease and how much the boys love it (they drink more water when I offer it versus other water cups) we deal with the leaking. But I wish CamelBak could somehow fix that- the larger water bottles we bought for my husband and I years ago do the same thing and it's been frustrating sometimes (BIG water spots on our seats in the car, etc.). Also, the mouth pieces get mold inside eventually; we have straw cleaners we use for other kid's cups with straws, and if you just pull it out (which is very easy to do with these kid's water bottles) you can scrub it down on the inside and keep it nice for a while. Although we did eventually have to buy replacement mouthpieces after about 6 months with the first water bottle we got for boy #1. There were some black spots we eventually couldn't clean out.

reviews.text: We used this at our daughter's gymnastics party for favors for her friends. They were perfect! Now after almost 6 months of using, I can say they have held up really well. I would buy them again without hesitation.

reviews.text: This cup is perfect for kids! I've tried so many different cups/bottles for my son & rarely find any I like. My main issue with most of them is how difficult/impossible the lids are to wash properly! Unless u have a dishwasher, (which I don't), its extremely hard, if not literally impossible to clean every nook & cranny in some of the lids & pieces! Even with my special tiny brushes I got for this exact purpose, I often still can't access areas to clean them well. That is not an issue with this cup! Every area is accessible for thorough cleaning, which is rare for a spill-proof lid! So that alone scored major points with me. Also, I love that it's very durable. After a few months of use, my son still hasn't broken or even dented it, which is amazing! Plus, it keeps drinks ice cold for a long time. I can send this cup to school with my son & his drink stays cold all day! Other perks are: ‚Ä¢the spill proof lid ‚Ä¢its easy for kids to use ‚Ä¢it has a hard plastic spout, not a squishy soft nubby which can be bad for dental health Finally, the best part is the great price! Most kids no-spill, insulted, durable (metal) cups (especially cups that hold more than 8-10oz) are too expensive! With how easily my son loses or breaks them, there's NO WAY I'm spending $15-25+ on a cup for my kid! Finding one of this quality & size with such a near perfect design for this price is unheard of! This is a crazy good deal!! I definitely recommend it. Point being, u don't have to shop around or hesitate.. I'm telling u now.. this cup is great & well worth the cost! U won't regret this purchase, I promise!!

reviews.text: The DOMICARE 40 oz Insulated Water Bottle has quickly become an essential part of my daily routine, and I can confidently say it delivers on every promise. Whether you're staying hydrated at the gym, on a hike, or during a long workday, this bottle is the perfect companion for keeping beverages cold, fresh, and easily accessible. Design and Build Quality The black stainless steel design is sleek, modern, and durable. The matte finish not only looks great but also provides a comfortable grip. It feels sturdy in hand, and the double-wall vacuum insulation ensures exceptional performance. Even on hot days, the exterior remains condensation-free, which is a huge plus when carrying it in a bag or placing it on furniture. Insulation Performance This water bottle excels at keeping drinks cold for hours. I tested it with ice water, and even after 12 hours, there were still ice cubes inside‚Äîa testament to its superior insulation. While I haven‚Äôt used it for hot beverages yet, I have no doubt it would perform equally well based on its solid build and insulation design. Versatility and Convenience The inclusion of both a straw lid and a spout lid is a thoughtful touch. The straw lid is perfect for easy sipping during workouts or when driving, while the spout lid is ideal for quick hydration on the go. Both lids are leakproof, so I never worry about spills, even when the bottle is tossed in a bag. The wide-mouth opening makes it easy to add ice or clean thoroughly. Eco-Friendly and Practical The bottle's reusable design aligns with my commitment to reducing single-use plastics. Its 40 oz capacity ensures I stay hydrated throughout the day without needing constant refills, and it‚Äôs lightweight enough to carry around without being cumbersome. Final Thoughts The DOMICARE 40 oz Insulated Water Bottle is an outstanding product that combines style, functionality, and durability. It's versatile enough to meet the needs of an active lifestyle, yet practical for everyday use. If you're looking for a reliable, high-performance water bottle that looks great and delivers on insulation, this is an excellent choice. Highly recommended!

reviews.text: Nalgene remains the most reliable water bottle in the market. Tried and tested (I have a good 20 of them), these bottles are durable, can be used for multiple purposes-- I use them as water bottles but also use them to store rice and pulses in the kitchen, as well as to store juice to keep in the fridge and hot herbal teas to carry on the go. I have also used some to store beads, screws, crayons, and virtually anything that needs organizing. In terms of liquid, they hold hot and cold effectively and they are leak proof. The wide mouth is excellent to drink and makes cleaning them a breeze. I also like that they clean well and do not hold any smells. Notably, these bottles are clumsy-hands friendly. The smaller size of this one is great to carry out and about in my hand but it also takes minimal space in my handbag and backpack. The colour is lovely! The combo of the deep red and yellow/mustardy lid is very quirky. I would totally recommend!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2025
reviews.title: Best and most reliable water bottle in the market

reviews.text: This little Nalgene bottle surprisingly versatile. As an avid backpacker, I'm always looking for dual use items and this fits the bill. I love the Nalgene brand and have used their 1L bottles for a long time. As I've started to reduce the weight of my pack I swapped out the heavy Nalgene for smart water bottles unless I'm going somewhere there is snow. This bottle is the best of both worlds. It's the same great materials but lighter in the weight department. It can hold boiling water and not melt. It's great to take a hot water bottle into your sleeping bag when its cold. It fits in my shoulder holster, so it's great for quick access to electrolytes. I also use it for dehydrating vegetables. I pour in the water in the morning and my veggies are ready to cook at dinner time. No worries about it opening in my pack as Nalgene is a brand you can trust. I also use it for rehydrating meat but that's only for about 15 minutes and its the perfect container for sun tea. Give it a try, you'll be surprised at how useful this bottle can be!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2024
reviews.title: Great little bottle!

reviews.text: I read in the reviews how so many people return these because of their size. I personally love the size as it fits my needs. These are also great for kids! The small size is great for my post-run recovery shake. I can keep the powder in this and bring along a larger Nalgene for filling it plus extra water for hydration OR I can bring just it filled with the correct amount of water and the recovery powder in a baggy to add when I need it. It is small and convenient to carry. The colors are vibrant and fun! I also sometimes use it as a pre-run electrolyte hydration drink. Just chug it on my drive to the trail. This way I am not overdoing it by filling a large Nalgene and overdrinking. I love them and this is my fourth purchase of them. My tween kids borrow them constantly.

reviews.text: Medium sized somewhat thermal water bottle, food-safe stainless steel, includes an easy-to-use sipper (press with your thumb and it pops up), a finger or lanyard handle, and a silicon boot that helps keep the bottle from sliding around. It holds more water that a compact 1-cup bottle and a bit less than popular Nalgene-style bottles that are sold for camping (see size comparison pic). The advantage over the Nalgene is that it keeps items colder for longer and can also be used for hot liquids. I have a strong preference for tube-shaped bottles. They're easier to clean. I prefer the compact bottles over the big ones since I have to bring them into meetings and they need to be somewhat unobtrusive. This bottle holds enough water to last most of the day without standing out more than it should. It's also a good lunch-box bottle. Extra straw attachment included.

reviews.text: This review pertains to the Mollcity 12 oz flask. The straw has a weak attachment inside the lid. The attachment point is offset straw so if the bottle is packed with ice the straw can be knocked out of the holder as it is twisted closed. Although the 14 oz flask also has an offset straw, its attachment is more secure and doesn‚Äôt get pulled out. I have both and they both keep drinks cold. I fill them half full of ice a night and there is usually ice left 24 hours later. I do recommend either size though. I would prefer that the straw is centered so ice doesn‚Äôt trap it but the design doesn‚Äôt allow that. I‚Äôve used other brands that do have a central straw but the mouthpiece is soft silicone tubing which picks up food stains and is hard to clean. The Mollcity bottles have hard plastic mouthpieces which I think are more hygienic.
